episode_title: 222 - The One With the Two Parties
note: [Scene: Moondance Diner. Ross, Phoebe, Joey, and Chandler are sitting at the counter, Monica is working. Monica is wearing her costume, including big fake breasts.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, I’ll get candles and my mom’s lace tablecloth, and since it’s Rachel’s birthday, I mean, we want it to be special, I thought I’d poach a salmon.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Ohhh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Question. Why do we always have to have parties where you poach things?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You wanna be in charge of the food committee?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Question two. Why do we always have to have parties with committees?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really. Why can’t we just get some pizzas and get some beers and have fun?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I agree. Ya know, I think fancy parties are only fun if you’re fancy on the inside and I’m just not sure we are.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Alright. If you guys don’t want it to be special, fine. You can throw any kind of party you want.
[Joey is staring at Monica’s breasts]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey they’re not real. I start miles beneath the surface of these things, ok, they’re fake. See [squeezes her breast] honk honk.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wow, it’s, it’s like porno for clowns.

content.description: Central Perk. Chandler, Ross, Joey, Phoebe, and Monica are planning Rache’s birthday party.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I talked to Rachel’s sisters, neither of them can come.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ok, um so, I still have to invite Dillon and Emma and Shannon Cooper.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Woah, woah, woah, uh, no Shannon Cooper.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why not her?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Cause she uh, she steals stuff.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Or maybe she doesn’t steal stuff and Joey just slept with her and never called her back.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey that is horriable.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey I liked her, alright. Maybe, maybe too much. I don’t know I guess I just got scared.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m sorry, I didn’t know.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I didn’t think anyone’d buy that, ok.
[Rachel enters]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi honey, how did it go?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Agh, it was the graduation from hell.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ya know, my cousin went to hell on a football scholarship.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ya know, I mean this is supposed to be a joyous occasion. My sister’s graduating from college, nobody thought she would. It’s a true testament to what a girl from long island would do for a Celica.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So what happened?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: My parents happened. All they had to do was sit in the same stadium, smile proudly, and not talk about the divorce. But nooo, they got into a huge fight in the middle of the commencement address. Bishop Tutu actually had to stop and shush them. But you know what, you know what the good news is? I get to serve coffee for the next 8 hours.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, so I guess we don’t invite her parents.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, how bout just her mom?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why her mom?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Cause I already invited her.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, ooh, did you ask Stacy Roth?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh no, can’t invite her. She also steals.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Chandler, Joey, Monica, and Phoebe are setting up for the party.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, here are the birthday candles. Where’s the birthday cake?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ok, we’re not having birthday cake, we’re having birthday flan.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Excuse me?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s a traditional Mexican custard dessert.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh that’s nice. Happy birthday Rachel, here’s some goo.
[knock at the door]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: [answers the door] Dr. Green. Oh my God it’s Rachel’s dad. What’re you doing here?

content.speaker: Mr. Green
content.text: What? The father can’t drop by to see the daughter on her birthday?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No no, the father can, but um, since I am the roommate I can tell you that she’s not here and I’ll pass along the message, ok. So bye-bye.

content.speaker: Mr. Green
content.text: Ohhh, you’re having a parteee.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, no, not a party. Just a surprise gathering of some people Rachel knows. Um, this is Phoebe and Chandler and Joey.

content.speaker: Mr. Green
content.text: I’ll never remember all of that. So uh, what’s the deal? Rachel comes home, people pop out and yell stuff, is that it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This isn’t your first surprise party, is it sir?
[knock at the door, Monica answers to see Mrs. Green]

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Hi Monica.
[Monica slams the door back shut]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chinese menu guy. Forgot the menus.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, basically just a Chinese guy.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, hey, Dr. Green, why don’t you come with me, we’ll put your jacket on Rachel’s bed.

content.speaker: Mr. Green
content.text: Alright, that sounds like a two person job. [they walk into Rachel’s bedroom]

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Well, my goodness, what was that?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sandra, I am so sorry, I thought you were Rachel and we just weren’t ready for you yet.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: You thought I was Rachel?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes because uh, you look so young.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And because you’re both, you know, white women.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Oh, I missed you kids. Well, should I put my coat in the bedroom?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: NO! No, I’ll take that for ya.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Oh well thank you. Such a gentleman. Thank you. [Chandler takes the hot pink coat and grimaces at it] Ahh, it all looks so nice, so festive, all the balloons… [Chandler, remembering that Joey and Mr. Green are in the bedroom, throws her coat in a cupboard] The funniest thing happened to me on the way here. I was…[Joey peeks out]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: [cutting Mrs. Green off] Ha-ha, that’s great, ha-ha. I can’t wait to hear the rest of it, ya know, but I really have to go to the bathroom so… Hey, come with me. Yeah, yeah, it’ll be like we’re gal pals, ya know, like at a restraunt. Oh, it’ll be fun, c’mon. [they go in the bathroom]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God, oh my God, oh my God.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ok, think, what would Jack and Chrissy do?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: [peeks back out] Ok, now that your coat is safely in the bedr-, [sees that the coast is clear] oh, ok we can come back out in the living room.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So uh, Joey and Chanlder, I, I think it’s time that you take Dr. Green over to your place.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uhh, yes, absdolutely, um. Why again?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Because that’s where the party is you goon. See this is just the staging area.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Right this is staging.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, this more than anything else, is the staging area.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: [as they’re walking out, Dr. Green questioningly gestures at the Happy Birthday sign over the door] This is clearly in the wrong apartment. [they all walk across the hall]

content.description: Later on in the hallway between the apartments. Chandler is showing people to the parties.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Alright you guys are off to party number one [ushers 3 guys into Monica’s apartment] and you, you are off to party number two [ushers four women into his apartment. Two guys try to follow and Chandler blocks them and shoos them off to Monica’s apartment] Alright fellas, let’s keep it movin’, let’ keep it movin.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler could you at least send some women to my party? [buzzer goes off] Alright that’s Ross.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ok, they’re coming, shhh. [Runs into Monica’s apartment and grabs one last girl to take to his apartment]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, thank you for the wonderful dinner.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks for being born.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, thank you for my beautiul earrings, they’re perfect. I love you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, now you can exchange them if you want, ok.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Now I love you even more.
[they kiss and Ross backs her into her apartment and turns on the lights]

content.speaker: All
content.text: Surprise.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my gosh, wow. Monica. Oh my god. Mom. This is so great.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Happy birthday sweetie.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow you, you. I had no idea.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, I knew.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ok, everybody, there’s food and drinks on the table. Go across the hall.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Right now, Joey and Chandler’s, go now.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Just go.
[they walk across the hall]

content.speaker: All
content.text: Surprise.

content.speaker: Mr. Green
content.text: Happy birthday sweetpea.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Daddy.
[Ad break. Time lapse. Still at party at Chandler and Joey’s. Rachel is talking to Chandler and Ross.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Both of them are here, both of them, both of them are here?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, we could count again.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I can’t believe this is happening.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You know what, this is ridiculous, ok. This is your birthday, this is your party. I say we just put ’em all together and if they can’t deal with it, who cares.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I do.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s who.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, are you gonna be ok?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I have to be, I don’t really have a choice, I mean, you know, I could look at the bright side, I get two birthday parties and two birthday cakes.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, actually just one birthday flan.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s a traditional Mexican custard dessert…Look talk to Monica, she’s on the food committee.
[Time lapse. Chandler runs out of the bathroom.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey, Joey. Hey, some girl just walked up to me and said, ‘I want you Dennis,’ and stuck her tounge down my throat. I love this party.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Quick volleyball question.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Volleyball.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, we set up a court in your room. Uh, you didn’t really like that grey lamp, did you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey, a woman just stuck her tounge down my throat, I’m not even listening to you.

content.speaker: Girl’s Voice
content.text: Dennis.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ok, that’s me. [runs back]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Listen honey, can you keep dad occupied, I’m gonna go talk to mom for a while.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok, do you have any ideas for any openers?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uhh, let’s just stay clear of ‘I’m the guy that’s doing you daughter’ and you should be ok.
[Back in Monica’s party]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ok people, I want you to take a piece of paper, here you go, and write down your most embarassing memory. Oh, and I do ask that when you’re not using the markers, you put the caps back on them because they will dry out.
[Back in Chandler and Joey’s party]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi Dr. Green. So, uh, how’s everything in the uh, vascular surgery…game?

content.speaker: Mr. Green
content.text: It’s not a game Ross, a woman died on my table today.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m sorry. See that’s the good thing about my job. All the dinosaurs on my table are already dead.
[Back in Monica’s party]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Listen you guys, I don’t mean to be a pain about this but, um, I’ve noticed that some of you are just placing them on. You wanna push the caps until you hear them click. [she demonstrates, Gunther starts to walk to the door] Gunther, where’re you going?

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: I um, was sorta thinking about maybe…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No. No you can’t go. No this is fun. Come on we’re just getting started. Here, here’s your marker.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Listen if you wanna go, just go.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: No, she’ll yell at me again.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Alright, I can get you out.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Shh. In a minute, I’m gonna create a diversion. When I do, walk quickly to the door and don’t look back.
[Back at Chandler and Joey’s party]

content.speaker: Mr. Green
content.text: I think I need a drink.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, here, I, I’ll get it for ya. Whad’ya want?

content.speaker: Mr. Green
content.text: Scotch.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Scotch. Alright, I’ll be back in 10 seconds with your scotch on the rocks in a glass.

content.speaker: Mr. Green
content.text: Neat.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Cool.

content.speaker: Mr. Green
content.text: No no no, no no no, neat, as in no rocks.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know.
[Back at Monica’s party]

content.speaker: Mr. Green
content.text: Oh hello Ross, where have you been?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi. Uh, I have been in the bathroom. Stay clear of the salmon mousse.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Oh, scotch neat. Ya know, that’s Rachel’s father’s drink.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, mine too. Isn’t that neat, scotch neat. Would you excuse me? [walks out in the hallway, Mr. Green is walking out of Chandler and Joey’s apartment] Hey, hey, where you uh, sneakin off to mister?

content.speaker: Mr. Green
content.text: I’m getting my cigarettes out of my jacket.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No. no.

content.speaker: Mr. Green
content.text: Whad’ya mean no?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, um, see ’cause that, that is, that is the staging area. If you go in there, it’ll ruin the whole illusion of the party. Yeah, I think you take your scotch back in there and I will get your cigarettes for you sir.

content.speaker: Mr. Green
content.text: Get my glasses too.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All righty roo. [closes the door] What a great moment to say that for the first time. [goes to get the cigarettes and glasses]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ok, the first person’s most embarassing memory is, ’monica, your party sucks.’ Very funny.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no, ooh, ooh, did somebody forget to use a coaster?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What? [she runs over to where Phoebe is, Phoebe signals for Gunther to go] I don’t see anything.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Great, I’m seeing water rings again.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Ross, whose glasses are those?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Mine.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: You wear bi-focals?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Um-hmm. [puts them on] I have a condition, apparently, that I require two different sets of focals.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Did you know my husband has glasses just like that?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well those are very popular frames.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Neil Sedaka wears them.

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: [to Phoebe] I hear you can get people out of here.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Rachel, you didn’t tell me your boyfriend smoked.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, like a chimney.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohh, big smoker. [Packs the cigarettes and flings one on Mrs. Green in the process. Finally gets one in his mouth and it look really out of place] Big big smoker. In fact I’m gonna go ou into the hallway and fire up this bad boy. [as he walks into the hall, he comes face to face with Mr. Green]

content.speaker: Mr. Green
content.text: Are you wearing my glasses?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes. [pulls them off and hands them to Mr. Green] I was just warming up the earpieces for you.

content.speaker: Mr. Green
content.text: Thank you. Is that one of my cigarettes?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [pulls the cigarette off his upper lip and hands it to Mr. Green] Yeah, yes it is, I was just moistening the tip.
[Back in Monica’s party. Phoebe is talking to a guy and two girls at the party.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, ok, she’s taking the trash out so I can get you out of here but it has to be now, she’ll be back any minute.

content.speaker: Girl 1
content.text: What about my friend Victor?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, only the three of you, any more than that and she’ll get suspicious.

content.speaker: Girl 1
content.text: Alright, let me just get my coat.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: There isn’t time. You must leave everything. They’ll take care of you next door.

content.speaker: Girl 1
content.text: Is it true they have beer?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Everything you’ve heard is true.
[Back at Chandler and Joey’s party. Everyone is dancing and having fun.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Could you guys please try to keep it down, we’re trying to start a Boggle tournament.
[Chandler and Joey stop dancing and laugh at her]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You, and you, you’re supposed to be at my party. And Gunther! What are you doing here?

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Um [gestures to dance floor]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: [enters with the three people she got out] Ok, welcome to the fu-oh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Alright, I’m sorry but these people needed me. They work hard all week, it’s Saturday night, they deserve to have a little fun. Go.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ya know, my party is fun. I mean, maybe it’s a little quieter, less obvious sorta fun but, you know, if people would just give it a chance… [volleyball hits her in the head from behind]
[Back at Monica’s party]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You want me to see a therapist?

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Sweetheart, you obviously have a problem. You’ve chosen a boyfriend exactly like your father.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok mom, you know what, fine, I’ll make an appointment ok, but you know what, right now, I gotta go, I gotta go do a thing.
[Chandler and Joey’s party]

content.speaker: Mr. Green
content.text: Did you know your mother spent $1200 dollars on bansai trees. I felt like Gulliver around that place.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Daddy, daddy, you know what, I really wanna hear more about this, I really do, but I just have, I just have to do a, some stuff.
[Monica’s party]

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: You work and you work and you work at a marriage but all he cares about is his stupid boat.
[Chandler and Joey’s party]

content.speaker: Mr. Green
content.text: You work and you work and you work on a boat…

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: He always ridiculed my pottery classs…

content.speaker: Mr. Green
content.text: …and you sand it and you varnish it…

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: …but when all is said and done, he still drinks out of the mugs.

content.speaker: Mr. Green
content.text: …and her yoga and her Bridges of Madison County…

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: …the scotch and the cigarettes…

content.speaker: Mr. Green
content.text: …and the bansai’s and the chiuaua…

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: …I may have only been in therapy for three weeks now dear but…

content.speaker: Mr. Green
content.text: …what the hell does she want with half a boat…

content.description: The hallway after the party. Rachel is sitting there.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [running out of his apartment after a girl] Ok, ok, you can be shirts and I’ll be skins. I’ll be skins. [sits down beside Rachel] Hey, how you holdin’ up there, tiger? Oh, sorry, when my parents were getting divorced I got a lot of tigers. Got a lot of champs, chiefs, sports, I even got a governor.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: This is it, isn’t it? I mean, this is what my life is gonna be like. My mom there, my dad there. Thanksgiving, Christmas. She gets the house, he’s in some condo my sister’s gonna decorate with wicker. Oh, Chandler how did you get through this?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I relied on a carefully regimented program of denial and, and wetting the bed.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ya know, I just, so weird. I mean I was in there just listening to them bitch about each other and all I kept thinking about was the fourth of July.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Becasue it reminded you of the way our forefathers used to bitch at each other?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s just this thing. Every year we would go out on my dad’s boat and watch the fireworks. Mom always hated it because the ocean air made her hair all big. My sister Jill would be throwing up over the side and my dad would be upset becasue nobody was helping and then when we did help he would scream at us for doing it wrong. But then when the fireworks started, everybody just shut up, you know, and it’d get really cold, and we would all just sort of smush under this one blanket. It never occured to anybody to bring another one. And now it’s just…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I, I know. [Hugs her. Ross walks out and Chandler puts her in his arms.]

content.description: Monica’s party. She is seeing off the last of the guests.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ok, thanks for coming, I hope you guys had fun.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Alright, Monica dear, I’m gonna hit the road. Now I’ve left my 10 verbs on the table. And you be sure and send me that finished poem.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ok will do. So glad you came.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: I think I saw Rachel out in the hall.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ok, let me go check. Your mom want’s to say goodbye.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh ok.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Happy birthday sweetie.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok.
[Mr. Green opens the door to Chandler and Joeys apartment. Ross sees him and runs to the door forcing him back in then holds onto the door knob.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ahh, you drive safe.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Ross, what’re you doing.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m getting ready for the water skiing. [Mr. Green opens the door which pulls Ross in] How are you doing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, uh, Dr. Green, where are you going?

content.speaker: Mr. Green
content.text: To get my coat.

content.speaker: Guys
content.text: No no no.

content.speaker: Mr. Green
content.text: Alright, alright, I can get my own coat.
[the guys form a wall between Mrs Geller and Mr Geller and dance across the hall as he walks across]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sorry, we’re on a major flan high.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no, you’re not supposed to be here. This is the staging area, you should, it’s all wrong, you should leave, ya know, get out. [opens the door, the guys are right there] Or perhaps you’d like a creme d’menthe.

content.speaker: Mr. Green
content.text: I have to be heading to my chateau, thank you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh all right, then I guess we’re going back into the hallway.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thanks for coming Mrs. Green. [grabs her and kisses her to distract her. She goes limp in his arms. Mr. Green leaves.] Well, ok, you take care.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Oh, you kids [she caresses his face and chest] Well, this is the best party I’ve been to in years.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thank you.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Close up of the flan on the table with birthday candles.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ok everybody, it’s time for flan.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yup, get ready for the gelatenous fun.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Kinda looks like that stuff you get when you get a bad infection.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ok, that’s enough.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok Rachel, make a special flan wish.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, I’ve got one. [blows out the candles. Somebody calls out ‘heads up’ and the volleyball lands in the flan] Wow, those things almost never come true.
